messages.subject: RE:HI- I am new :)
messages.msgSnippet: Glad to have you! Just FYI, I believe their are several Melissa s on the group. You might want to add a last initial or state or whatever! I may be the only
messages.messageBody:
Glad to have you! Just FYI, I believe their are several Melissa's on the
group. You might want to add a last initial or state or whatever! I may be
the only one who gets confused?
I think unschooling is started before birth, but it took me a LONG time to
get the concept of unschooling and apply it to my family. I still learn
every day. My kiddos are 9, 13, and 16. I was unschooled, I officially left
government school at age 12.

Livin' Learnin' and Lovin' it!
Wildflower

_________________________________________________________________

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] HI- I am new :)
messages.msgSnippet: Welcome to the group Melissa. kelly Melissa  wrote: I have just joined :) and interested to share and read with you all. I have two little
messages.messageBody:
Welcome to the group Melissa.
kelly

Melissa <honeybee@...> wrote:
I have just joined :) and interested to share and read with you all.
I have two little girls, 4 and 21 mos. I have been on some close
groups and feel odd to just hop in here, hope it is ok ?!?!? lol
I have always known we were going to "some other type of school", way
before we even had our children. Recently have I really looked hard
into unschooling, and it seems to be what I have been looking for.
Which leads me to why I am here :)
thanks, Melissa

messages.subject: HI- I am new :)
messages.msgSnippet: I have just joined :) and interested to share and read with you all. I have two little girls, 4 and 21 mos. I have been on some close groups and feel odd to
messages.messageBody:
I have just joined :) and interested to share and read with you all.
I have two little girls, 4 and 21 mos. I have been on some close
groups and feel odd to just hop in here, hope it is ok ?!?!? lol
I have always known we were going to "some other type of school", way
before we even had our children. Recently have I really looked hard
into unschooling, and it seems to be what I have been looking for.
Which leads me to why I am here :)
thanks, Melissa
